いらっしゃる.definition: (respectful) to be, to come or to go

くれる.definition: (1) to give, (2) to get dark, to come to an end

ちっとも.definition: not at all (used with a negative verb)

うける.definition: to take a lesson or test

えんりょする.definition: to be reserved, to be restrained

おこる.definition: to get angry, to be angry

おみまい.definition: calling on someone who is ill, enquiry

さげる.definition: to hang, to lower, to move back

さわぐ.definition: to make noise, to be excited

たてる.definition: (1) to stand something up, (2) to build

とっきゅう.definition: limited express train (faster than an express train)

とどける.definition: to send, to deliver, to report

なおる.definition: (1) to be fixed, to be repaired, (2) to be cured, to heal

なくなる.definition: (1) to disappear, to get lost, (2) to die

ぬる.definition: to paint, to colour, to plaster

のりかえる.definition: to change between buses or trains

ふつう.definition: usually, or a train that stops at every station

むかし.definition: old times, old days, long ago, formerly

わく.definition: to boil, to grow hot, to get excited

受ける.definition: to take a lesson or test

遠慮.definition: to be reserved, to be restrained

怒る.definition: to get angry, to be angry

お見舞い.definition: calling on someone who is ill, enquiry

君.definition: (1) (informal) You, (2) suffix for familiar young male

暮れる.definition: to get dark, to come to an end

下げる.definition: to hang, to lower, to move back

騒ぐ.definition: to make noise, to be excited

特急.definition: limited express train (faster than an express train)

届ける.definition: to send, to deliver, to report

直る.definition: to be fixed, to be repaired

塗る.definition: to paint, to colour, to plaster

乗り換える.definition: to change between buses or trains

普通.definition: usually, or a train that stops at every station

昔.definition: old times, old days, long ago, formerly

沸く.definition: to boil, to grow hot, to get excited
